sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using block matrices
message_1:
Consider the system of linear equations:
\begin{align*}
 5x + 3y + 2z &= 1, \\
 4x - 2y + 5z &= -4, \\
 2x + 4y + 3z &= 18.
\end{align*}

Using block matrices, solve for the values of $x$, $y$, and $z$.
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using block matrices, we first represent the system in matrix form:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
 5 & 3 & 2 \\
 4 & -2 & 5 \\
 2 & 4 & 3
\end{bmatrix}
\begin{bmatrix}
 x \\
 y \\
 z
\end{bmatrix}
=
\begin{bmatrix}
 1 \\
 -4 \\
 18
\end{bmatrix}.
$$

Now, we can write this as $AX = B$, where $A$ is the matrix of coefficients, $X$ is the column vector of variables, and $B$ is the column vector of constants. To find $X$, we can multiply both sides by the inverse of $A$, i.e., $A^{-1}$:

$$
A^{-1}AX = A^{-1}B \implies X = A^{-1}B.
$$

First, we need to find the inverse of matrix $A$. We can do this by finding the determinant of $A$ and then finding the adjugate matrix of $A$.

The determinant of $A$ is:

$$
\det(A) = 5(-2 \cdot 3 - 5 \cdot 4) - 3(4 \cdot 3 - 5 \cdot 2) + 2(4 \cdot 4 - 2 \cdot 2) = -60 + 18 + 24 = -18.
$$

Now, we find the adjugate matrix of $A$:

$$
\text{adj}(A) =
\begin{bmatrix}
 (-2)(3) - (5)(4) & (3)(5) - (2)(4) & (3)(2) - (-2)(5) \\
 (4)(3) - (5)(2) & (5)(2) - (2)(5) & (4)(5) - (2)(4) \\
 (4)(4) - (2)(2) & (2)(5) - (3)(4) & (5)(3) - (3)(2)
\end{bmatrix}
=
\begin{bmatrix}
 -26 & 7 & 16 \\
 2 & 0 & 16 \\
 12 & 2 & 11
\end{bmatrix}.
$$

Now, we find the inverse of $A$ by dividing the adjugate matrix by the determinant:

$$
A^{-1} = \frac{1}{\det(A)} \cdot \text{adj}(A) = \frac{1}{-18}
\begin{bmatrix}
 -26 & 7 & 16 \\
 2 & 0 & 16 \\
 12 & 2 & 11
\end{bmatrix}
=
\begin{bmatrix}
 \frac{13}{9} & -\frac{7}{18} & -\frac{8}{9} \\
 -\frac{1}{9} & 0 & -\frac{8}{9} \\
 -\frac{2}{3} & -\frac{1}{9} & -\frac{11}{18}
\end{bmatrix}.
$$

Now, we can find $X$ by multiplying $A^{-1}$ by $B$:

$$
X = A^{-1}B =
\begin{bmatrix}
 \frac{13}{9} & -\frac{7}{18} & -\frac{8}{9} \\
 -\frac{1}{9} & 0 & -\frac{8}{9} \\
 -\frac{2}{3} & -\frac{1}{9} & -\frac{11}{18}
\end{bmatrix}
\begin{bmatrix}
 1 \\
 -4 \\
 18
\end{bmatrix}
=
\begin{bmatrix}
 2 \\
 -1 \\
 3
\end{bmatrix}.
$$

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is $x = 2$, $y = -1$, and $z = 3$.
